Package com.netflix.genie.agent.execution.statemachine

Class ExecutionStage

java.lang.Object
com.netflix.genie.agent.execution.statemachine.ExecutionStage
Direct Known Subclasses:
ArchiveJobOutputsStage, ClaimJobStage, CleanupJobDirectoryStage, ConfigureAgentStage, ConfigureExecutionStage, CreateJobDirectoryStage, CreateJobScriptStage, DetermineJobFinalStatusStage, DownloadDependenciesStage, HandshakeStage, InitializeAgentStage, LaunchJobStage, LogExecutionErrorsStage, ObtainJobSpecificationStage, RefreshManifestStage, RelocateLogFileStage, ReserveJobIdStage, SetJobStatusFinal, SetJobStatusInit, SetJobStatusRunning, ShutdownStage, StartFileServiceStage, StartHeartbeatServiceStage, StartKillServiceStage, StopFileServiceStage, StopHeartbeatServiceStage, StopKillServiceStage, WaitJobCompletionStage
public abstract class ExecutionStage extends Object
Abstract base class for Genie Agent stage of execution. The execution state machine is constructed as a sequence of stages that each job goes through (e.g., claim job, setup job directory, launch job, etc). Each stage consists of a state machine state and an action that needs to be completed in order to successfully transition to the next stage. This action is implemented in concrete subclasses.

Stages are categorized along these dimensions: - Critical vs. optional: if a critical stage fails, execution is aborted and the job is considered failed. Optional stages can produce fatal error without compromising the overall execution (example: job file archival). - Skippable vs. non-skippable: skippable stages are skipped if a job was aborted due to fatal error or kill.

Since:
4.0.0

    • attemptStageAction

      protected abstract void attemptStageAction(com.netflix.genie.agent.execution.statemachine.ExecutionContext executionContext) throws RetryableJobExecutionException, FatalJobExecutionException
      Action associated with this stage. May be skipped if execution is aborted and the stage is defined as skippable, or if the action was attempted and threw a fatal exception, or if the retriable attempts were exhausted.
      Parameters:
      executionContext - the execution context, carrying execution state across actions
      Throws:
      RetryableJobExecutionException - in case of error that deserves another attempt (for example, temporary failure to connect to the server
      FatalJobExecutionException - in case of error that should not be retried (for example, trying to use a job id that was already in use)
